quiz.name: Module 1: Introduction to Financial Statement Analysis
quiz.subtopic: Module 1: Introduction to Financial Statement Analysis

warehouses.name: Practice Pack Warehouse: Financial Statement Analysis 26-LI
warehouses.code: Practice Pack Warehouse: Financial Statement Analysis 26-LI

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.09-FRA-Vervloet-01
entry.itemBody: Which of the following is most likely found in the management commentary?

answerFeedback.08a7edca-683a-403d-840d-64f60fdc479c: Incorrect because under ISAs, the overall objectives of an auditor in conducting an audit of financial statements are: to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements as a whole are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error, thereby enabling the auditor to express an opinion on whether the financial statements are prepared, in all material respects, in accordance with an applicable financial reporting framework.
answerFeedback.8ab2ca4f-88b0-4c55-a487-155b35631b70: Correct because the management commentary, or MD&A, is a good starting place for understanding information in the financial statements. In particular, the forward-looking disclosures, such as those about planned capital expenditures, new store openings, or divestitures, can be useful in projecting a company’s future performance.
answerFeedback.941b209a-6576-42c3-8e46-04ba8a7ed634: Incorrect because the notes disclose the basis of preparation for the financial statements.

choices.itemBody: B. Basis of preparation for the financial statements
C. Reasonable assurance whether the financial statements as a whole are free from material misstatement

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.09-FRA-Vervloet-02
entry.itemBody: Which of the following is most appropriately issued when an auditor determines that the financial statements materially depart from accounting standards and are not fairly presented?

answerFeedback.b5b35a97-5992-476a-8cbd-0a2502dd7588: Incorrect because "a disclaimer of opinion occurs when, for some reason, such as a scope limitation, the auditors are unable to issue an opinion."
answerFeedback.daf01e08-614b-4818-8da7-1e52b28adb17: Correct because "[a]n adverse audit opinion is issued when an auditor determines that the financial statements materially depart from accounting standards and are not fairly presented."
answerFeedback.f71ae006-95b0-487b-8889-4af3406b6eda: Incorrect because "[a] qualified audit opinion is one in which there is some scope limitation or exception to accounting standards. Exceptions are described in the audit report with additional explanatory paragraphs so that the analyst can determine the importance of the exception."

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.09-FRA-Mazararu-01
entry.itemBody: Which of the following statements is most accurate? The role of financial statement analysis is to:

answerFeedback.6aca975f-f13c-4057-8bb7-23ac7ad0a327: Incorrect because this describes the role of audit report not financial statement analysis as follows: the independent audit report provides reasonable assurance that the financial statements are fairly presented, meaning that there is a high probability that the audited financial statements are free from material error, fraud, or illegal acts that have a direct effect on the financial statements.
answerFeedback.ce313da6-e2fc-4067-bdd6-e6837f5c1405: Incorrect because this describes the role of financial reporting not financial statement analysis as follows: the role of financial statements issued by companies is to provide information about a company’s performance, financial position, and changes in financial position that is useful to a wide range of users in making economic decisions.
answerFeedback.f43a9a49-9ad2-40f6-8e45-447ec19a561b: Correct because the role of financial statement analysis is to use financial reports prepared by companies, combined with other information, to evaluate the past, current, and potential performance and financial position of a company for the purpose of making investment, credit, and other economic decisions.

choices.itemBody: A. provide assurance that the audited financial statements are free from material error.
B. provide information about a company’s performance, financial position, and changes in financial position.
C. evaluate the performance and financial position of a company for making investment, credit, and other economic decisions.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-00981
entry.itemBody: Common-size statements are most likely the output of which of the following phases of the financial statement analysis framework?

answerFeedback.6c576fa6-e608-48eb-ae54-c8382568b486: Correct because common-size statements are an output of the “process data” phase of the financial statement analysis framework.
answerFeedback.a83d83f6-d294-4a5a-9065-10638ad4b051: Incorrect because analytical results, not common-size statements, are the output of the “analyze/interpret the processed data” phase.
answerFeedback.e44695ac-4abd-4002-aaac-0dfba3b3194c: Incorrect because analytical reports and recommendations, not common-size statements, are outputs of the “develop and communicate conclusions and recommendations” phase.

choices.itemBody: C. Develop and communicate conclusions and recommendations

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2023.10-FSAN-Scott-04
entry.itemBody: Earnings calls are most likely sourced from:

answerFeedback.1a9f74bc-3861-4452-816e-68aac19364c8: Correct because "earnings calls" are considered to be from "issuer sources".
answerFeedback.d42f358f-b914-4405-9f1e-bf4c97cde54c: Incorrect because "earnings calls" are considered to be from "issuer sources", not public third-party sources.
answerFeedback.d4428a88-6f0b-44ae-983d-7249ff6d602e: Incorrect because "earnings calls" are considered to be from "issuer sources", not proprietary third-party sources.

entry.title: CFA2417-R-s06-Q1

feedback.neutral: C is correct. Ratios are an output of the process information step but are an input into the analyze/interpret data step.

entry.itemBody: Ratios are an input into which step in the financial statement analysis framework?

entry.title: CFA2417-R-s06-Q2

feedback.neutral: A is correct. The follow-up phase involves gathering information and repeating the analysis to determine whether it is necessary to update reports and recommendations.

entry.itemBody: Which phase in the financial statement analysis framework is most likely to involve producing updated reports and recommendations?

choices.itemBody: C. Develop and communicate conclusions and recommendations

entry.title: CFA2417-R-s06-Q3

feedback.neutral: C is correct. In general, analysts seek to examine the past and current performance and financial position of a company to form expectations about its future performance and financial position.

entry.itemBody: Which of the following best describes the role of financial statement analysis?

choices.itemBody: A. To provide information about a company’s performance
B. To provide information about a company’s changes in financial position
C. To form expectations about a company’s future performance and financial position

entry.title: CFA2417-R-s06-Q4

feedback.neutral: B is correct. The primary role of financial statement analysis is to use financial reports prepared by companies to evaluate their past, current, and potential performance and financial position for the purpose of making investment, credit, and other economic decisions.

entry.itemBody: The primary role of financial statement analysis is best described as:

choices.itemBody: A. providing information useful for making investment decisions.
B. evaluating a company for the purpose of making economic decisions.
C. using financial reports prepared by analysts to make economic decisions.

entry.title: CFA2417-R-s06-Q5

feedback.neutral: B is correct. The International Accounting Standards Board (IASB) is currently charged with developing International Financial Reporting Standards.

entry.itemBody: International Financial Reporting Standards are currently developed by which entity?

entry.title: CFA2417-R-s06-Q6

feedback.neutral: B is correct. US Generally Accepted Accounting Principles are developed by the US Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB).

entry.itemBody: US GAAP are currently developed by which entity?

entry.title: CFA2417-R-s06-Q7

feedback.neutral: C is correct. A core objective of IOSCO is to ensure that markets are fair, efficient, and transparent. The other core objectives are to reduce, not eliminate, systemic risk and to protect investors, not all users of financial statements.

entry.itemBody: A core objective of the International Organization of Securities Commissions is to:

choices.itemBody: C. ensure that markets are fair, efficient, and transparent.

entry.title: CFA2417-R-s06-Q8

feedback.neutral: C is correct. The notes provide information that is essential to understanding the information provided in the primary statements.

entry.itemBody: Which of the following best describes why the notes that accompany the financial statements are required? The notes:

choices.itemBody: C. provide information necessary to understand the financial statements.

entry.title: CFA2417-R-s06-Q9

feedback.neutral: C is correct. The notes disclose choices in accounting policies, methods, and estimates.

entry.itemBody: Accounting policies, methods, and estimates used in preparing financial statements are most likely to be found in the:

entry.title: CFA2417-R-s06-Q10

feedback.neutral: B is correct. Disclosure of management compensation is typically included in the proxy statement. An earnings release is about corporate earnings, not what managers earn as compensation.

entry.itemBody: Information about management and director compensation is most likely to be found in the:

entry.title: CFA2417-R-s06-Q11

feedback.neutral: B is correct. These are components of management commentary.

entry.itemBody: Information about a company’s objectives, strategies, and significant risks are most likely to be found in the:

entry.title: CFA2417-R-s06-Q12

feedback.neutral: C is correct. An unqualified opinion is a “clean” opinion and indicates that the financial statements present the company’s performance and financial position fairly in accordance with applicable accounting standards.

entry.itemBody: What type of audit opinion is preferred when analyzing financial statements?

entry.title: CFA2417-R-s06-Q13

feedback.neutral: B is correct. A qualified audit opinion is one in which there is some scope limitation or exception to accounting standards. Exceptions are described in the audit report with additional explanatory paragraphs so that the analyst can determine the importance of the exception.

entry.itemBody: An auditor determines that a company’s financial statements are prepared in accordance with applicable accounting standards except with respect to inventory reporting. This exception is most likely to result in an audit opinion that is:

entry.title: CFA2417-R-s06-Q14

feedback.neutral: B is correct. The independent audit report provides reasonable assurance that the financial statements are fairly presented, meaning that there is a high probability that the audited financial statements are free from material error, fraud, or illegal acts that have a direct effect on the financial statements.

entry.itemBody: An independent audit report is most likely to provide:

choices.itemBody: A. absolute assurance about the accuracy of the financial statements.
B. reasonable assurance that the financial statements are fairly presented.
C. a qualified opinion with respect to the transparency of the financial statements.

entry.title: CFA2417-R-s06-Q15

feedback.neutral: B is correct. Interim reports are typically provided semiannually or quarterly and require certain financial information, including unaudited financial statements and an MD&A for the interim period covered by the report. Unqualified refers to a type of audit opinion.

entry.itemBody: Interim financial reports released by a company are most likely to be:

entry.title: CFA2417-R-s06-Q16

feedback.neutral: B is correct. When performing financial statement analysis, analysts should review all company sources of information as well as information from external sources regarding the economy, the industry, the company, and peer (comparable) companies.

entry.itemBody: Which of the following sources of information used by analysts is found outside a company’s annual report?

entry.title: ITEM_20170608001
entry.itemBody: Which of the following statements is most accurate about the responsibilities of an auditor for a publicly traded firm in the United States? The auditor must:

answerFeedback.073b29d0-c1aa-4c68-b818-dc7fab9fb1d9: Incorrect. The statements are those prepared by management, not the auditor. The auditor is expressing an opinion as to whether the statements are fairly presented and free from material error.
answerFeedback.1969ade6-76ac-4a97-9e4a-23dea0bdd00a: Correct. For a publicly traded firm in the United States, the auditor must express an opinion as to whether the company’s internal control system is in accordance with the Public Accounting Oversight Board, under the Sarbanes–Oxley Act. The opinion is given either in a final paragraph in the auditor’s report or as a separate opinion.
answerFeedback.9baec78e-605f-4ee0-8178-d8b470bd2d3a: Incorrect. The auditor only provides reasonable assurance that the statements are free from material error.

choices.itemBody: A. state that the financial statements are prepared according to generally accepted accounting principles.
B. ensure that the financial statements are free from error, fraud, or illegal acts.
C. express an opinion about the effectiveness of the company’s internal control systems.

entry.title: ITEM_20170608002
entry.itemBody: Providing information about the performance of a company, its financial position, and changes in financial position that is useful to a wide range of users is most accurately described as the role of:

answerFeedback.05d26746-03c7-401a-b046-fb392421878c: Incorrect. The role of financial statement analysis is to take the financial reports and evaluate the past, current, and prospective performance and financial position of a company for the purpose of making investment, credit, and other economic decisions.
answerFeedback.530bd1a2-aefb-4fcc-b9cd-fcdc17c3fe99: Incorrect. Audit reports express an opinion about the fair presentation of the financial statements.
answerFeedback.aa41f3d6-f591-4c3a-bf87-414133cd7a3e: Correct. The role of financial reporting is to provide information about the performance of a company, its financial position, and changes in financial position that is useful to a wide range of users in making economic decisions.

entry.title: ITEM_20170608015
entry.itemBody: Which of the following reports is least likely to be filed with the US SEC?

answerFeedback.22c2e6e5-c766-4a03-9f9c-495b097575f6: Incorrect because the 10-K is required by the US SEC.
answerFeedback.8112f9d7-77d8-4d42-ab7d-332207794d24: Correct because the annual report is not a requirement of the US SEC.
answerFeedback.b0679653-95ac-453f-8a75-734732c15525: Incorrect because a proxy statement is required by the US SEC.

entry.title: ITEM_20170608037
entry.itemBody: Interim reports most likely:

answerFeedback.a4add90c-29dd-46e4-8024-538ba2308970: Correct. Interim reports are provided semi-annually or quarterly, depending on applicable regulatory requirements.
answerFeedback.a5693d68-1363-4561-b232-256c2e7d8c17: Incorrect. Interim reports generally present the four basic financial statements and condensed notes.

choices.itemBody: C. include a full set of financial statements and notes.

entry.title: ITEM_20170608050
entry.itemBody: Notes to financial statements most likely include:

answerFeedback.544025cb-a836-4f41-aec3-4a739ff26c20: Correct because the notes also disclose information about the accounting policies, methods, and estimates used to prepare the financial statements.
answerFeedback.e761cc27-c926-4f65-8c4c-0393287cb608: Incorrect because to help improve the quality of the discussion by management, the International Accounting Standards Board (IASB) issued an IFRS Practice Statement “Management Commentary” includes a framework for the preparation and presentation of management commentary. The framework provides guidance rather than sets forth requirements in a standard. The framework identifies five content elements of a “decision-useful management commentary”: (1) the nature of the business; (2) management’s objectives and strategies; (3) the company’s significant resources, risks, and relationships; (4) results of operations; and (5) critical performance measures.
answerFeedback.f43252d1-069c-4103-aa41-d84733ad11d8: Incorrect because the audit process provides a basis for the independent auditor to express an opinion on whether the information in the audited financial statements presents fairly the financial position, performance, and cash flows of the company in accordance with a specified set of accounting standards.

choices.itemBody: A. an auditor’s opinion as to the fair presentation of the financial statements.
B. supplementary information about accounting policies, methods, and estimates.
C. a discussion of significant trends, events, and uncertainties that affect the operating results.

entry.title: ITEM_20170608148
entry.itemBody: The role of the International Organization of Securities Commissions (IOSCO) is best described as:

answerFeedback.1b35294d-a690-471f-94a7-238610bffe88: Incorrect because maintaining convergence on new standards remains a priority of both standard-setting bodies [IFRS and FASB].
answerFeedback.9090049f-43b8-4a2a-baf3-1a638190d365: Incorrect because the US SEC (not IOSCO) has primary responsibility for securities and capital markets regulation in the United States and is an ordinary member of IOSCO.
answerFeedback.b8171017-17c5-4e64-8d03-0573611595ba: Correct because IOSCO assists in attaining the goal of uniform regulation as well as cross-border cooperation in combating violations of securities and derivatives laws.

choices.itemBody: A. promoting cross-border cooperation and uniformity in securities regulation.
B. enforcing financial reporting requirements for entities participating in capital markets.
C. promoting the use of International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) and the convergence of national accounting standards.

entry.title: ITEM_20170608204
entry.itemBody: For a company issuing securities in the United States to meet its obligations under the Sarbanes–Oxley Act, which of the following is management required to attest to?

answerFeedback.21dc254e-59d5-4421-9b96-52555295b8d3: Incorrect because the notes to the financial statements disclose information about the accounting policies, methods, and estimates used to prepare the financial statements.
answerFeedback.703fd78e-7b06-4f78-9f4e-69dee4d264da: Correct because the [Sarbanes–Oxley] act addresses auditor independence (it prohibits auditors from providing certain non-audit services to the companies they audit); strengthens corporate responsibility for financial reports (it requires executive management to certify that the company’s financial reports fairly present the company’s condition); and requires management to report on the effectiveness of the company’s internal control over financial reporting (including obtaining external auditor confirmation of the effectiveness of internal control).
answerFeedback.aa98041d-041b-44f9-9ae6-1159b55c9f34: Incorrect because the SEC requires that shareholders of a company receive a proxy statement before a shareholder meeting. A proxy is an authorization from the shareholder giving another party the right to cast its vote. Shareholder meetings are held at least once a year, but any special meetings also require a proxy statement. Proxies, especially annual meeting proxies, contain information that is often useful to financial analysts. Such information typically includes proposals that require a shareholder vote, details of security ownership by management and principal owners, biographical information on directors, and disclosure of executive compensation. Proxy statement information is filed with the SEC as Form DEF-14A.

choices.itemBody: A. The adequacy of internal control over financial reporting
B. The suitability of management and director compensation agreements
C. The accuracy of estimates and assumptions used in preparing the financial statements

entry.title: ITEM_20170608299
entry.itemBody: Common-size financial statements are most likely a component of which step in the financial analysis framework?

answerFeedback.3775d011-e4ee-4436-9efa-bdae6ee5f42d: Incorrect. Preparing common-size financial statements is part of the process data stage, after which the analyst will analyze/interpret the processed data.
answerFeedback.6060f795-2c1e-4706-9ad2-9654232a9fc6: Correct. Preparing common-size financial statements is part of the process data step.
answerFeedback.bb904f9b-5e64-41ac-bd99-f9a709873609: Incorrect. The financial statements are obtained in the collect data step, but not converted into common-size statements until the process step.

entry.title: ITEM_20180516111
entry.itemBody: Where might an analyst look for details covering the full extent of a company’s capital resources?

answerFeedback.21d57646-50b2-40ee-b494-6995d6693bcd: Incorrect because the balance sheet discloses what an entity owns (assets), what an entity owes (liabilities), and the owners’ interest in the net assets of a company (equity) at a specific point in time. While the balance sheet can include a section summarizing non-current (long-term) liabilities, this usually includes just a single line item listing the total amount of a company’s long-term debt due after one year with no information about a company’s capital resources, including debt financing and off-balance-sheet financing.
answerFeedback.28b4e439-e1b7-42e4-82a7-8988854bf398: Correct because in the MD&A, management must highlight any favorable or unfavorable trends and identify significant events and uncertainties that affect the company’s liquidity, capital resources, and results of operations. The MD&A must also provide information about off-balance-sheet obligations and about contractual commitments, such as purchase obligations.
answerFeedback.8df3c93f-2f99-4c4e-bac0-d4699241ab8c: Incorrect because, while the notes to the financial statements provide details about a company’s debt financing, it is the MD&A section that commonly provides information about its off-balance-sheet financing. The notes disclose the basis of preparation for the financial statements. The notes also disclose information about the accounting policies, methods, and estimates used to prepare the financial statements.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-04115
entry.itemBody: A qualified audit opinion is most likely issued when financial statements are prepared:

answerFeedback.35d0a662-387a-4d03-b731-92d8712d40e3: Incorrect because material departures from accounting standards will earn an adverse opinion.
answerFeedback.3805e15f-62dc-41ae-b9f8-090fef313bfd: Correct because financial statements showing “scope limitation or exception to accounting standards” will earn a qualified opinion.
answerFeedback.5fb968d8-b336-46b8-9fbe-f3db00f4c5cc: Incorrect because financial statements that are in compliance will earn an unqualified opinion.

choices.itemBody: B. with material departures from accounting standards.
C. with some limitation or exception to accounting standards.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-01957
entry.itemBody: A disclaimer of opinion is issued when an auditor:

answerFeedback.06c1c5d0-3648-4bb2-a506-bcca1d64d4e2: Correct because a disclaimer of opinion occurs when auditors are unable to issue an opinion.
answerFeedback.61cc099a-64b1-400b-9552-5ce1b4f0e6a9: Incorrect because a qualified opinion (rather than a disclaimer of opinion) would be appropriate in the case of some scope limitation or an exception to accounting standards.
answerFeedback.b908d982-ea24-4246-83d5-a82465f18f45: Incorrect because an adverse opinion (rather than a disclaimer of opinion) would be appropriate if the auditor determines that financial statements materially depart from accounting standards and are not fairly presented.

choices.itemBody: A. is unable to issue an opinion.
B. notes an exception to accounting standards.
C. finds a material departure from accounting standards.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020-C2-FRA-Terry-01
entry.itemBody: The role of financial reporting is best described as:

answerFeedback.0e72c6a4-a4e6-4c84-aa4d-ec65ea40f2fe: Incorrect because the role of financial statements issued by companies is to provide information about a company’s performance, financial position, and changes in financial position. The answer describes the role of financial statement analysis. The role of financial statement analysis is to use financial reports prepared by companies, combined with other information, to evaluate the past, current, and potential performance and financial position of a company for the purpose of making investment, credit, and other economic decisions.
answerFeedback.1c08d7c5-d3ee-4818-8d3c-cfe03fba5702: Correct because the role of financial statements issued by companies is to provide information about a company’s performance, financial position, and changes in financial position.
answerFeedback.a7a76a4a-3a59-4d93-8841-1f44d518fa33: Incorrect because the role of financial statements issued by companies is to provide information about a company’s performance, financial position, and changes in financial position. The answer describes the role of management analysis: managers within a company perform financial analysis to make operating, investing, and financing decisions but do not necessarily rely on analysis of related financial statements.

choices.itemBody: B. providing information about a company's performance, financial position, and change in financial position.
C. evaluating a company's past, current, and potential performance for the purpose of making economic decisions.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-10007
entry.itemBody: Which of the following opinions is the best indication that the auditor believes that the financial statements depart materially from accounting standards and are not fairly presented?

answerFeedback.84c97fd6-affe-440d-9b3b-9b0f6f841b49: Incorrect because a disclaimer of opinion occurs when, for some reason, such as a scope limitation, the auditors are unable to issue an opinion.
answerFeedback.edbd18fc-aae1-42b1-8664-48f22652c8e7: Incorrect because a qualified audit opinion is one in which there is some scope limitation or exception to accounting standards. Exceptions are described in the audit report with additional explanatory paragraphs so that the analyst can determine the importance of the exception.
answerFeedback.fa465686-8f65-43d1-823b-0795edb51b00: Correct because an adverse audit opinion is issued when an auditor determines that the financial statements materially depart from accounting standards and are not fairly presented.
